t: Psalm 83
A song. A psalm of Asaph.
O*pn God, do not remain silent; do*ld not turn a deaf ear, do*ld not stand aloof, O God.
See*ln how your enemies growl, how*ld your foes rear their heads.
With*ln cunning they conspire against your people; they*ld plot against those you cherish.
“Come,”*ln they say, “let us destroy them as a nation, so*ld that Israel’s name is remembered no more.”
With*pn one mind they plot together; they*ld form an alliance against you—
the*ln tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites, of*ld Moab and the Hagrites,
Byblos,*ln Ammon and Amalek, Philistia,*ld with the people of Tyre.
Even*ln Assyria has joined them to*ld reinforce Lot’s descendants.
Do*pn to them as you did to Midian, as*ld you did to Sisera and Jabin at the river Kishon,
who*ln perished at Endor and*ld became like dung on the ground.
Make*ln their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb, all*ld their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna,
who*ln said, “Let us take possession of*ld the pasturelands of God.”
Make*pn them like tumbleweed, my God, like*ld chaff before the wind.
As*ln fire consumes the forest or*ld a flame sets the mountains ablaze,
so*ln pursue them with your tempest and*ld terrify them with your storm.
Cover*ln their faces with shame, Lord,*s so*ld that they will seek your name.
May*pn they ever be ashamed and dismayed; may*ld they perish in disgrace.
Let*ln them know that you, whose name is the Lord—*s that*ld you alone are the Most High over all the earth.
